name: Chicken Piccata
headline: Chicken Piccata
description: For dinner this week, make Giada De Laurentiis' famous Chicken Piccata recipe, a comforting Italian classic made with lemon, butter and capers.

author.name: Giada De Laurentiis Bio & Top Recipes

recipeIngredient: 2 skinless and boneless chicken breasts, butterflied and then cut in half
Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper

recipeInstructions.text: Season chicken with salt and pepper. Dredge chicken in flour and shake off excess.

In a large skillet over medium high heat, melt 2 tablespoons of butter with 3 tablespoons olive oil. When butter and oil start to sizzle, add 2 pieces of chicken and cook for 3 minutes. When chicken is browned, flip and cook other side for 3 minutes. Remove and transfer to plate. Melt 2 more tablespoons butter and add another 2 tablespoons olive oil. When butter and oil start to sizzle, add the other 2 pieces of chicken and brown both sides in same manner. Remove pan from heat and add chicken to the plate.

Into the pan add the lemon juice, stock and capers. Return to stove and bring to boil, scraping up brown bits from the pan for extra flavor. Check for seasoning. Return all the chicken to the pan and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove chicken to platter. Add remaining 2 tablespoons butter to sauce and whisk vigorously. Pour sauce over chicken and garnish with parsley.

review.reviewBody: Never tasted it or made it before. Wasn‚Äôt difficult. Several times I thought I was doing something wrong but I stuck to the recipe and it turned out great. The one person in the house that knows and loves it said I did a great job.
Love this recipe I like any lemon chicken my all-time favorite, and easy to do
I‚Äôve been making this for years and it‚Äôs still one of our favorites.
A perfect dish. Great for a Tuesday or a dinner party. I serve with capellini or polenta and let the extra sauce have a vehicle!
Yes!  This recipe was fantastic.  My husband loved it.  Thank you

This is a great recipe. I use it constantly. It‚Äôs easy, not a lot of ingredients, and fairly quick to make. I only add to things: 1. I add Cavander‚Äôs Greek Seasoning to the flour and 2. I pound the chicken to 1-1/2 inches thick. Otherwise the recipe is perfect. I always get lots of compliments when I make this from family, friends, and whomever I give it to.
AMAZING !! I have tried several chicken piccata recipes & this is by far the best one
I make this recipe often. My family loves it. My husband hates lemon. I use a little and add white wine.
Exce;lent
Excellent recipe. I‚Äôll be making this again in the near future

I've made this recipe many times before, but used Giada's ingredient proportions as a guide to a perfect piccata! A perfect blend of lemon and zesty saltiness from the capers mellowed out with the chicken broth and parsley for a fresh taste of herbiness!
Followed the recipe. The sauce was too lemon intense for me. I added 2 tblsp honey & 1/4 cup Marsala. Served over GF linguini & a side salad. Good.
Bro literally holy chicken. Jesus loves us so much it‚Äôs crazy
This was perfect. I made it tonight with my first time of making home made pasta and then put the pasta in the sauce. I think I could beat #BobbyFlay with this dish. üòâ

Delicious meal! Capers are like bacon - very hard to make it taste bad!  My two warnings for rookie cooks: 1) don‚Äôt have the heat up too high that you burn the outside of the chicken and 2) flour is like an exploding dye pack - it will go everywhere so handle it gently!
Not hard and everybody loved it!
It‚Äôs so delicious that I struggle to describe how deliciously delicious it is I‚Äôve never had better chicken in my life besides the Costco chicken bake
Very great way to make tasty chicken breast she has that way of explaining her dish and i want to thank her for her cooking technique!!
Super easy and delish! Thanks Giada!
This is a very easy recipe but tastes like you‚Äôve been working all day. It‚Äôs so rich and full of flavor. All you need is a side of rice and broccoli
Made this for dinner for my bf and I. He said it was delicious! Will definitely make this again. So good!
Delicious! I serve it with Giada‚Äôs lemon pasta.
Made this last night for dinner for my husband and MIL.  It was a wonderful success. I‚Äôll be making this again.
I've made this many times. Great recipe.
Made this! Absolutely perfect
My hubby loved this. Only added half the lemon juice and it was perfect!
Had high hopes as we make lots of Goads recipes. Way too much lemon and everything else bland. Not one I will make again.
10/31/23 chicken was super moist and delicious. Made a lot of sauce. Yum.
Absolutely delicious!

It was excellent. I added mushrooms to the sauce and it added more depth and flavor.
So good!
Simple, quick and delicious.
Excellent recipe. I made one substitution because I did not have any capers on hand, so I substituted pesto.
Way way way to much lemon juice!!! Beware.
It was very good. I will use it again.
This recipe was easy to follow and had great tasting ingredients. I will definitely keep this one!
Quick and easy and delicious, I have made this several time and always a great dinner. Makes me look like a chef. Love it!!
I have made this a few times now and served guests as well as my own family.  It is a huge hit. This time I used chicken tenders.  Best Chicken Piccata recipe ever.

I make this often; it‚Äôs in the rotation!
So easy and delicious. Good for both quick weekday for two or Sunday supper with the family!
I add artichoke hearts for extra brinyness! So good!
Oh my!!!! Soooooo good. We just finished dinner as we are watching Hurricane Idalia go by. Perfect dinner. Delicious and easy.
Simple and delicious.
Love this recipe! Wouldn't change a thing. This is a staple in our house since it's so easy, quick, and delicious.

I loved it except 1/3 cup of lemon juice was a bit too much. I had to add more broth to dilute the lemon but it was still very tart. Otherwise it was so fast and easy. I will make it again with less lemon.

Everything went according to plan except when I got to the end of cooking the thighs. The oil was too dark and I discarded it. Then melted 2 more Tbsp of butter and 3 of oil‚Ä¶ 2 Tbsp of the dredging flour and made a rue. To that I added the chicken broth, Lemon juice and capers and a little more salt. I put the cooked chicken back in the pan and basted it with the sauce. I‚Äôm sure Giada‚Äôs was much better but this was excellent.
The black oil would‚Äôve ruined itüòµ‚Äçüí´
I was craving Chicken Piccata and local restaurant was closed. Thank you‚Ä¶OMG so good!
I loved it so much flavor
Quick, easy, and better than what I‚Äôve had in any restaurant! Even my husband who isn‚Äôt a chicken enthusiast enjoyed it! Adding leftovers to today‚Äôs salad!!
Easy and delicious üòã

I made this recipe for the first time last night.  I will definitely be adding this to my list. I loved the flavor. My husband even liked it.  I am always nervous, introducing new recipes to him.  I need to learn to make more of the sauce. I ‚ù§Ô∏è this recipe. I no longer have to wait until I go to a restaurant to get this dish.
My husband said this is the best chicken he‚Äôs had in his entire life. AWESOME!!!! Thank you!!! Your recipes and videos are the absolute best!!!!
Easy to make and tasty

Jeanmarie:

I gave it 4 stars because it didn‚Äôt have enough sauce. I will add more chicken broth when I make it again. Otherwise it was super delicious!
So easy and so good !!

I think this is just about the best recipe to make a kind of so so meal into something really good.It was easy ( I lucked out having all the ingredients on hand).The only thing I added was some fresh thyme.This is now a recipe I will go to.
Great, easy recipe with delicious results!
I have been making this chicken piccata for several years. I make it exactly as written, except I add a couple of cloves of garlic. No need for any other recipe.
This recipe is easy to follow and easy to make. My husband said,‚ÄùThis is delicious restaurant quality food!‚Äù I will definitely add this recipe to my dinner making arsenal. Thank you Giada. ‚ò∫Ô∏è
Love this recipe! I serve over noodles and it‚Äôs delicious as leftovers as well!

I tried this recipe, today.

Absolutely delicious üòã

I will make this again.
So easy and delicious!! My husband loved it, we had it over spaghetti. I shared it with my adults sons who loves easy recipes. For sure we‚Äôll have it over and over again üòã

I‚Äôve made this recipe several times and we love it.  My only changes were a bit less lemon juice and a couple of splashes of dry white wine which allows to reduce a little longer. Those changes were made over cooking this recipe several times and they are changes to our personal taste.  There is nothing wrong with the original as is!

It was wonderful
No changes needed, i served with yellow rice with vegetables DELICIOUS Aracely

Exquisite! Chock full of flavor without being overly lemony. Our sides were mashed potatoes and roasted asparagus. Totally a 'company's coming' meal that plates beautifully.
My hubs used 1.5 lbs of chicken breasts which made enough chicken piccata for 2 nights' meals. Highly recommend!
Amazing recipe! The chicken was tender and the sauce delightful! Loved the fresh lemon juice! So easy to make!
I doubled the recipe and I was perfect!! I made it for company and everyone loved it! Will deinitely make it again! ‚ù§Ô∏è
Made this several different times, once with flour rest without - like it without the flour and i use less butter - so yumm - i also do not wash the capers
I made this recipe with a little less butter and no stock as I was out.  It turned out delicious.  The chicken was really moist and flavorful. I also pounded the chicken just a titch.

I have made this recipe multiple times and it is wonderful. My family loves it. It's so tangy and rich in flavor. Even my picky family enjoys it. I made it exactly as written and I am happy with the final product. Yummy

my dad is an amazing chef and one of my favorite meals he made was chicken piccata. i made this dish with my dads cooking in mind and it truly did not disappoint! I'm definitely a lemon-lover and the amount used in the recipe was just right for me. The only thing I changed was using more chicken stock than what it called for. I noticed how tangy the sauce with1/2c of stock, so I added roughly another 1/2c. Other than that I highly recommend this dish!

Made with boneless pork chops pounded thin instead of chicken because it‚Äôs what I had on hand. i also added minced garlic and used the full cup of broth. I served it over pasta and it was delicious!
We love chicken piccata and just found this recipe.  Didn't change a thing - so good it was restaurant quality.  served over fettucine with sauteed broccoli and steamed fresh peas.  Yum!
Oh My! So yummy! I followed the recipe except after reading the comments, I used a full cup of chicken stock instead of a half cup.
Delicious! Always a crowd pleaser and so easy to make!

Glad I read the reviews before making this! I tweaked several things and it turned out delicious, but that means I get 5 stars, LOL! This recipe in it's original state is probably a 3 star recipe. Not enough stock/broth, no wine, too much lemon juice, doesn't allow for the sauce to reduce in volume to intensify flavor. All in all, I wouldn't bother with this one as is folks
The flavor really popped. Really easy to make and scrumptious!  Adding it to the save list.
A friend of mine made this for dinner and served it on noodles with Brussels sprouts on the side.  Better than any Italian meal I have ever had in a restaurant

this is the easiest recipe!  However, as good as butter tastes, I cut the butter in half and added a little more evoo and some white wine.   delicious!   this is the best recipe when you don't know what to make and you have chicken in the freezer.  Enjoy!

Loved this! Super fast/easy and I had everything on hand. Used the pre-sliced cutlets to save time, and I also didn't use quite as much butter to cook the chicken as it  seemed like a lot (and maybe less capers only b/c I didn't have that much and love the flavor they add but not the actual caper). Everything still tasted great.
Easy & delicious
Love the flavor.  The lemon gives the chicken a great brightness.
Simple yet awesome. For this (non) chef, super simple and great flavors. I have mostly followed exactly, but sometimes exchange boneless skinless thighs‚Ä¶would highly recommend.

I made this recipe exactly.  This is Delicious!  Very easy to make, very flavorful.  My only comment on this would be is that is says 4 servings.  Way too small for 4 since you cut the chicken breast in half.  My husband and I had this and salad and it was perfect.  Just delicious!!
Easy and super tasty!
This recipe has so much flavor!  Simply delicious!
Great recipe!!!
Love this recipe! Definitely a recipe for guest, easy to prepare.

I have been using this recipe for years and it is absolutely fabulous! I just cooked this recipe, with the help of a bunch of wonderful women, for 120 women. They absolutely loved it! Kudos from everyone and NO LEFTOVERS! It was great!
Perfect everytime. I started making this recipe years ago in college and now it is a regular easy dinner staple.
A family favorite. Easy to make and flavorful.
Excellent!! So easy ..

This is my go to chicken picatta recipe. Easy and delicious. Serve with angle hair pasta and asparagus.
Delish
Yummy

video.name: Giada De Laurentiis Makes a Lemony Chicken Piccata
video.description: Giada De Laurentiis shares an easy, flavorful recipe for chicken piccata that includes lemon and capers.
